criterion: Describes the relationship between bright lights and blurred vision.
States that blurred vision after bright lights is always a cause for concern and requires immediate medical attention.
Asks the user if they have any underlying medical conditions that could be contributing to the blurred vision.
Uses technical jargon and complicated medical terms that may confuse the user.
Provides a list of potential causes for blurred vision after bright lights, including some that are unlikely to be serious.
States that blurred vision after bright lights is a common side effect of a specific medication.
Asks the user if they have recently experienced any trauma or injury that could be contributing to the blurred vision.
Explains the possible underlying causes of blurred vision after bright lights in a clear and easy-to-understand manner.
Fails to provide any information about potential causes or underlying conditions for blurred vision after bright lights.
States that blurred vision after bright lights is a normal and harmless phenomenon.
Asks the user if they have recently had any changes in their vision or eye health.
Provides a clear explanation of what the user can do to alleviate the blurred vision after bright lights.
